review_blob: Clear copper with thin off white head that dissipates quickly. Kind of reminds me of a lighter version of one of those Innis & Gunn scottish ales. Surprisongly light and sweet. Aftertaste of alcohol, bread, and bubblegum. Odd. Pleasant drink nonetheless but probably wont buy again. Too many other good beers out there.
WOW. This is a remarkable stout. Completely opaque with a tan head. Very strong chocolate and roasted malt almost makes the alcohol content unnoticeable. Also, I love the can.
Really decent wee-heavy with some light stout characteristics. Roasty and sweet. Dark brown to the point of almost opaque. Hight malt and alcohol give this beer a great character.
beer_name: Nepenthe Ales Bourbon Barrel Aged Wee Heavy

review_blob: Sweet floral citrus aroma, but not strong like an IPA. Very attractive light copper color with a thick off white head. First taste is hops, malt, then alcohol. The high alcohol content really helps bring this beer to life. Malty for an american style, good caramel and bread, maybe some nuts if I try hard enough, haha. Very pleasant and drinkable for the alcohol content. I will enjoy this one again.
This is everything a full bodied brown ale should be. Nice sweet roasty taste with a roasty but clean finish. Heavy mouthfeel and nice dark color. Almost Perfect.

I am seldom disappointed in Belgian style strong ales but this is one of those rare caes. Light color and flavor for a Dubbel style, tastes of grape wine and earth at first and finishes with some brown sugar and...i dont know, something astringent. Not horribly offensive, but a very weak effort in the grand scheme of imitated Belgian brews.

Pours a dark reddish brown with a light off-white head. Sweet lightly fruity aroma with a hint of spice. Surprisingly light taste for such a dark beer. Sweet fruit, some malt and licorice coming through after. A bit boozy. Goes down really easy for 8.5%. Haha, maybe too easy. Overall very enjoyable although a bit light in body for my taste.

Of the few sour ales Ive had, this is the most unpleasant. Aroma is tart, some malt, mostly just tart. Mostly sour and malty taste with hints of cheese and sour puke. A tad disturbing to the palate. Mouthfeel isnt pleasant, kind of oily, filmy. Finish is puke, straight up. Really tried hard to appreciate this beer but cant find a single thing that will convince me to finish it. Really sad because Id really like to support a local brewery but so far not so good with White Birch :(

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange brown with tons of fluffy head. Aroma is malty bannana and clove, maybe a bit frutier than bannana. Taste is wheaty and fruity with some minor chocolate notes coming through in the end. A slight bitterness in the middle as well. This is a new style to me, so it took me a few sips to get used to it, but I do rather enjoy it. Mouthfeel is light and mildly carbonated.

Bottle. Girlfriend bought me this one. Pours a hazy greenish gold color with kind of a pinkish hue. Aroma is fruity and yeasty with notes of pear and spice. Taste beats the smell. Its a bit ricey and alcoholic and very sweet. The fruity tones are bitter. Im not terribly familiar with the sake scene, but I like this. Its different and refreshing. Good summer drink.

Swing top bottle, Im a real sucker for those. Pours a an amberish brown, almost a dark nut brown with a nice off white head. Smells of fruit and malt and some metal. Flavor is weak. Kind of nutty, roasty with a bit of hops and...water. Funny, the abv is only 4.8 but I can really taste it. Mouth feel is very watery. I really bet this would be an awesome beer if it had more body. The flavor definitely has potential, but theres just not enough of it. I will be fair and say that the bottle I am trying is pretty old, about 8 months I think. Im hoping a fresh one will be more promising but I have yet to find one.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black with a tan head. I can smell it from across my desk! Simply reeks of black coffee and chocolate with some fruity tones, sweet. Taste is chocolate malt with black coffee with a nice light bitterness. Such a nice strong and balanced flavor here. Palate is heavy and creamy. This beer is like comfort food! I concur with MrRosss rating under this one where he mentions the sexy bottle :)

Bottle. Pours a light clear golden with an average off white head. Smell of hops malt and some sweetness. WOW. Flavor is so unexpected and yummy! Hits like an IPA and finishes like a mead. Starts with hops and lightly burning alcohol (in a good way) and leaves a pleasant warm honey sweetness. Almost like a dryish mead with carbonation. I can taste some wheat and malt in there too. Carbonation interacts very nicely with the complex flavor and sticky texture of the beer.  This beer is a real treat!
beer_name: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir

review_blob: Bottle. Pours a very nice dark amber with a tan head. Smells roasty and a bit fruity. Tastes like it smells and looks. Nice robust chocolate/black coffee flavor with a nice malt hop balance. Very complex for a lager. Not a big fan of lagers, but this one might change my mind completely. Doesnt finish clean like a lot of lagers. The coffee lingers on, which is nice. Thus is just a great beer.

1997 vintage according to the deScription. Smells of soy sauce, maple syrup, or maybe burnt ah-so sauce (the red kind) Appearance is pitch black with dark brown film on the sides of the glass. Flavor is like boozy soy sauce with sugar. Some dark chocolate sneaks in there and lingers in the aftertaste. I can still taste the ah-so sauce. You ever use that stuff on pork and some of it comes off the meat and burns to the pan? Tastes like that. Not really a bad thing, strangely enough. Palate is thick and syrupy with no carbonation. Has its ups and downs. but ultimately undrinkable beyond a few sips. I dont dislike the flavor, but its not something I would want to drink. Actually, it tastes like it would be an AMAZING marinade! I will re-rate when I try that.

Fresh fruity hoppy aromy with some malt. Clear golden color with a short but fluffy white head. Flavor had a good balance between malt and hops but was a bit light. Slight hoppy bite to it. Mouthfeel is a bit oily, i think, but it can be easily ignored. Finish is somewhat clean with some lingering hops. Not really much to say about it, didnt excite me too much but its a nice summer beer for us lager haters.

Bottle. Pours golden blonde with a very tall off white head. Smell of fruit and hops, a little malt. Has a bitter bite to it followed by some fruit, malt and alcohol, lots of carbonation.  Has something else I cant quite point out, grass maybe. Hoppy fruity finish. Overall, this one has some bite and a long lasting aftertaste. Not bad, Ill drink it again.

Bottle. Aroma is light floral and malty, tad bit of skunk in there. Pours a nice copper tone with a short lived fluffy head.  Taste is light hops, bread, and a bit of fruit and malt on the lower levels. Theres kind of a tang near the end, but not like in a bad, budweiser sort of way. The finish is fruity, floral and bready. Mouthfeel could use some body, but not offensively light. Somehow, lots of flavors but not much excitement in this beer. Id drink it again, though.

Bottle. Pours a dark golden amber color with a bubbly tannish white head. Holy hops! I can smell this one across the room and its rather tempting. Aroma is very strong fruity hops with some malt. Taste is so piny its actually spicy. This beer has some serious bitter kick. Some malt and fruit can be detected but its quickly overpowered by hoppiness. Rather tasty I must say, but certainly a "sometimes" beer for me. Has a very long lasting very bitter finish. Fairly light body and the carbonation seems a bit weak, which I will assume isnt always the case. I will address that issue after another bottle of this and re-rate.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden tan color with a short lived white head. Aroma is wheaty and fruity and mild. Taste is very wheaty, a bit sour but not really bad. Flavor is light but certainly not bad. Maybe Im crazy but it almost has a honey unertone to it. Its certainly not a heavy beer but it has a pleasant flavor and a smooth, light mouthfeel, almost more like a lager than an ale. A bit watery but certainly not like budweiser. Not an amazing beer, but I would drink it again.

Bottle. pours dark red amber with a short but thick yellowish head. Aroma is malty and sweet with some fruitiness. Wow! Flavor is very pleasant. Malty and earthy and easy going. Mouthfeel is just as pleasant as the flavor, not light but not overly heavy. Has a slightly bitter hoppy finish. Overall, Id drink it again and again, this is a good "often" beer. Goes wonderfully with lamb or corned beef.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a very tall off white head. Fruity malty aroma, I like where this is going. Flavor is fairly hoppy with some light fruity and malty notes, bitter in the finish. Mouthfeel isnt heavy but its certainly not light, good body but not overly filling. Nice balance in this beer except that the finish is a bit on the bitter side for me, but some people like that. Overall, not a bad beer. Certainly beat my expectations as I have been putting off buying this one for some time.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange gold with a short lived head. Smells sweet and fruity with a hint of spice and sewage...yeah, i think its sewage. Taste is light with a bit of hops, orange peel, and sewage. Ohhhhhh, its a coors product, yeah thats why. After a few sips, I just cant get myself to finish it. So instead of sewer-water, coors made us some unfiltered, spiced sewer water. A fine macro-craft will rejoin the sewer tonight.

Bottle. Instant sweet chocolate aroma followed by an almost burnt roastiness, but in a good way. Appearance is ultra dark amber with a tall tan head. Flavor is bitter and sweet, very roasty and chocolatey. A pleasant flavor of malt and caramel lies underneath. Lots of flavors in here. Very thick mouthfeel but pleasantly smooth. This beer is like a meal in itself.

Bottle. Pours blackish amber with very fluffy and tall tan head. Smells of roast and malt and a tad sweet. Roasty hoppy taste actually conceals the lager flavor quite well at first. Mouthfeel is light but not watery. Finishes mostly clean with some lingering hops and lager flavor. A mostly uninteresting beer. The hops are really the only notable characteristic of this beer. Not bad but the boston lager actually has a more interesting flavor.

Bottle. Pours dark golden color with lots of fluffy off white head. Caramel and malt aroma. Taste is like a decent quality lager with a hoppy kick. Some maltiness but quickly overpowered by hops. Not a bad thing though. Not really a lager fan, but the hops in this one keep me from completely disliking it. Very simple flavor overall. If I really HAD to have lager, Id most likely get this one because its generally more tasty than most laagers Ive had. Palate is light but certainly not watery. Has a hoppy finish with a slight caramel lingering underneath.

Bottle from kappys. Aroma is malty and sweet with pine, go figure. Some fruity, sugary notes as well. Appearance is dark brown, hazy with a short, quickly disappearing head. Flavor is...strange. Definitely an ale flavor with malt and hops, but also piney and sweet. Certainly lives up to the deScription. Not a bad beer, but not one Id reach for again. Finish is piney with lingering hops and slightly alcoholic. I would like to try this without the pine infusion as I think it would be a decent ale. Otherwise, its interesting but not my cup o beer.
beer_name: Heather Ales Alba Scots Pine Ale

review_blob: MMM, unique aroma. Herbal, flowery honey smell. Very Sweet. Pours dark gold/amber, still, with no head. I think I just want to smell it and keep it at that out of fear that the taste wont live up! WHOA to the alcohol flavor! At 19%, im not surprised! Taste is very sweet and alcoholic but not as sweet as I"m used to with the mead around here, which is nice. After the initial sweetness, it becomes dry and finishes spicy with herbal overtones throughout. SO many flavors! Mouthfeel is lightly syrupy with a pleasant burn in the end.With all the alcohol (and $30 a bottle) its a sipper, not a swigger. I recommend this to all that love mead and are able to obtain this rarity (at least for my neck of the woods). A fitting drink for my fellow viking warriors!

Bottle. Pours light reddish gold with a yellowish and very tall fluffy head. Aroma is fruity and malty. Taste is lightly hopped and malty caramel over a lager-ish base. Finish is fruity followed by hops and maybe even a bit spicy. Despite the myriad of flavors, its not terribly exciting, but certainly enjoyable. Its fairly light and goes down pretty easy.

Bottle. Pours Dark amber, brown and clear. Medium thick fingerwidth head. Very malty flavor with some fruity and roasty tones. This beer has a lot of flavor! A little bit sweet, nice hop flavor, and lots of malt make this beer strong and unique. Mouthfeel is fairly light with a finish I cant put my finger on, maybe more malt? The ABV is pretty standard for american beer, but I think if it was less, the beer would be even more flavorful. I really love this beer though!

Bottle. Sweet malty aroma. Pours dark brown amber with a lasting light tan head. Sweet and bitter tones over a slightly malty and roasty flavor. Strange how I can taste honey, but not in a sweet way. Finishes bittersweet. Mouthfeel is thick but not too syrupy. Overall, I like it, but its more of a "sometimes" beer.

Re-rate : a few sips later I notice a lot more honey (but still not too sweet) in the finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Fruity, malty aroma. Pours a translucent gold with a fingerwidth white head. Flavor is slightly hoppy, slighly spicy, but not excessive in either case. Flavors overpower the beer a little more than I would want. Medium weight to the body. Overall, I really think its pleasant and refreshing, a bit odd, but not in a bad way.

1 pint bottle from Kappys. Strong aroma of apples and light beer (go figure). Appearance is thick cloudy yellowish gold with a nice tall head. Tastes of sweet apple cider and spices more than beer. Alocohol almost completely non-present in the flavor. Not dry in the least. Very crisp refreshing flavor although I can see many serious beer lovers not having an open mind to this one. Palate is a bit sticky but not so bad as to stop me from liking it. I think Ill be reaching for this after mowing my lawn instead of boring ol Budweiser.

375 ml bottle from Kappys in Revere, Ma. Pours a light goldish yellow. Aroma is strong, herbal, and kind of chemical-ish. Taste was surprisingly strong. Sweet but a bit dryer than Chaucers (which is the only common brand of mead around here). Goes fairly smooth with a strong herbal aftertaste. Not a mead I would recommend for a first impression, but certainly drinkable. Bottle is very attractive.

Bottle. This is the only mead I can find in my area. Being the only mead I have ever tried, I have not much to compare it to. Smells and tastes very sweet. Honey is strong and obvious, so much that when youre finished, the glass is sticky with honey. Goes down smooth with a very slight bite very similar to wine. I am very fond of this and hope I can find other kinds with more varieties of flavor. Could be a bit drier, but AMAZING when heated with mulling spices.

Growler from the brewery. Smells roasty, almost burnt, chocolately. Tall, thick light brown head. Almost pitch black, holding it to the light, its still solid blackish brown. Taste is bitterish with very obvious chocolate flavor, but not too sweet. A pleasant beer to have with a snack or dessert rather than a meal, i think. Not one to drink all the time, but a very good specialty beer to keep around for company.

Bottle: Its not the ultimate ale but for a regular common beer that can be found most anywhere, its one of the tastiest. Has a pleasant, smooth taste and feel. Goes down very easy. Flavor is light for an ale but satisfying, nonetheless. A bit sweet but not unpleasantly so. Good go-to ale when there arent any others.

Bottle. Its no ale, but for a lager, especially one brewed by Coors, its not bad. Its a decently attractive beer with a good amount of flavor for a lager. Being a lager, though, the aftertaste will be a bit sour. The taste gets stale pretty quickly so I wouldnt recommend more than one if you are at all concerned about flavor. Its more of an "Im in a pinch but I hate Budweiser" beer.

Bottle. Light gold with very little head. Thin body that makes seltzer water seem creamy by comparison. Flavor is that of stale cornbread with an unpleasantly sour aftertaste. I can only understand that this beer sells well because of those who need to get wasted on a budget but dont prefer an extremely light beer. Label looks like it should be a pack of cigarettes.
